reviewText:
Early Access Review

A point and click title that's so deep in Early Access that you can't click anything yet.

Where does this end? What's next? Do I log into Steam and find an Early Access title that's just two wireframes no-clipping through each other? Will I hand over £6.99 for a sound file of an assault rifle burst and some concept art scrawled on the back of a napkin of a stick figure with 'ZOMBEE SERVAYVAL GAEM' scrawled over it? Maybe I'll pay £11.99 for a step-by-step in Russian of how to slap the game together myself in GameGuru, like the software equivalent of flatpack furniture.

If you need to see I MUST KILL failing harder at merely existing than anything in recent memory, here's my, uh... playthrough? Can I legally call it that? I don't know. I'll go for it and turn myself in to the police in the morning, just to be safe.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mk8ZKszqSuo

reviewText:
Early Access Review

(Old. See update below.) Needs a lot of improvement. I mean I never have given this kind of review to any game.

Pros.
-Good sound quality.
-The art is okay. (Not that I judge the game based on the art.)
-Has some sort of potential. (Somewhere?)
-Free

Cons.
-There is nothing to do. You talk like twice in the game. You can inspect like 1 or two things in the entire game.
-Has an invintory but can't even pick things up
-Has no objective at all.
-Shows items that may be picked up such as a red mouse arrow but can't actually do anything with them.
-Isn't really a game. More like a pop up book with several sentances.


This game has potential to be good but you can't do anything. I know it's not finished but you have to introduce a GAME not a slide show with music and instead of adding more animations and pointless updates. How about you put stuff that will call it a game. That's all. Don't download this 'game'. Unless you want to waste your time.

-Update-

So appearently the people who made it has abandoned the game. As I said in my review that this game had lots of potential. It had decent music, interesting art style and could have had an interesting story. However this isn't really a 'game' even still. I know it's a work of progress it lack the essential to even be called a demo.  First off you cannot pick up or interact with anything which kinda weird concidering it's style. There is not realy story to it. No story of the character, the area or how everything happened.  I feel that I was a bit harsh on the whole don't download it unless you wanna waste your time. I do actually feel like they could have made a game. But they didn't introduce a game. Just a point and click where you move and that's really it. I can see it not be a game but a short story of sorts. Like a book. But it's not that either. As I said there is only like 5 lines in it at the beginning and that's it. They also removed the upstairs making it even interactive than before.

I hate to hear that they just left the game entirely and truely I don't think it's fair that people can just make devolpers upset. Even something like the money hungry and terrible game (Which is also 'free' and actually much much worse that this could be. Because that is a finished game. This isn't.) TheHunter which has a terrible community  and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ reviews it still has updates; awful ones.  But the people who came on here to expect a full or even half a game got really toxic due to it's lack of one. Which as I said it's fair. It isn't finished and now it isn't finished at all. Depite all this. Even with them leaving this game I still say no. Mainly because it's still not quite there. A lot of improvement much be taken even if it is a free game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is in early access. However, as of this moment there is nothing to do in it. I found only a few objects that had a listed name when you cursor hover, but you cannot click or interact with any object in the game. This is unacceptable for a point and click adventure, early access or not. Sure the game is free to play, but there is not much of a game to find here. I may revisit this game in a future video, but I cannot currently recommend it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAbout the only aspect of this game which seems to have escaped the earliest stages of Early Access is the soundtrack...and quite a nice soundtrack it is (simple, but effectively spooky and oppressive to be sure).  The graphics, on the other hand, are ugly as sin, and if there's one thing a game with ugly as sin graphics wants to have it's a darned good STORY.  Now call me cynical, but I'm not quite sure if the ability to walk around a handful of rooms at a snail-like speed, while being completely unable to interact with ANYTHING, whatsoever, qualifies as a story" just yet.  Hell
date: there was even one room which had a box of matches openly sitting on a table
recommended: and a crowbar poking out from under a closet
hoursPlayed: and if there were ever two items which just scream "pick me up
voteText: pick me up" in a horror game
helpfulPercent: that'd probably be them.  But no dice on this occasion.\n\nThe only things about this "game" which show even the slightest hint of potential are the enticingly tawdry title - perplexing grammar and all - and the sheer grubbiness of the premise itself (I mean
votesTotal: haven't you always wanted to play Leatherface's fatter
votesFunny: dumber cousin?  I know I have).  One can only assume that somewhere down the track there'll be a GAME somehow attached to said title and premise
commentsCount: but there's also every chance the devs will discover crystal meth instead and lead unproductive
column18: and no teeth.  Who knows?  Perhaps the world would be better off if they did...\n\nEven for the low
column20: I can only recommend this demo - if it even qualifies as such - to ♥♥♥♥wits like myself who enjoy writing reviews for bad games.  If you're NOT that kind of person
column21: your time may be better served strolling into the kitchen
column22: finding a suitably nasty cheese grater
column23: and doing unspeakable things to your genital region.  Sure it might hurt
column24: but at least you'll remember the experience
column25: which is more than I'll be able to say about this demo in fifteen to twenty minutes from now.\n\nVerdict: 2/10."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok....I'm done, why would you put an ADVENTURE GAME in Early Access on steam.... i saw this game on greenlight and was interested in it because it's from a czech studio/guys/guy, dunno and a few weeks after that it's on steam in Early Access, ohhhhh my god, well it wouldn't be a problem if the game actually worked, maybe i did something wrong but i don't think so, it's a point and click adventure game and i can click all i want but it wont do anything, all i can do is just walk around the house and watch my character getting bigger and smaller --->http://prntscr.com/993tr5 , http://prntscr.com/993u1d    all the items that are supposed to be doing something (my mouse change when i hover over them) your character will just walk torwards them and show you his nice butt  ---> http://prntscr.com/993vh9
Of course the game will get better, there will be updates and stuff, but WHY for an adventure game and it's free too. I don't know how the greenlight system works but i don't think that if the game have a lot of support they have to release the game immediately, that would be....well....weird. Steam is becoming one big hole for trash games with this system, everyone can create a shi**y game, make some screenshots, make a trailer and show some stupid gameplay, the game will get released in early access, few updates will come and that's it, after that the game will be dead like a lot of titles here on steam, now, if you excuse me, i'm going to click on some more items, thanks.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I personally believe this game has potential. But I do not think it was wise to offer Early Access when there is very little of the game completed. All the game gives you is the opening of the game, where the butcher gives you a little background story, giving a hint to go inside due to the coming storm. There is not much you can do other than walk around, and there is very few things to interact with. My only pet peeve is when you go in the house, you cannot exit the house again. I will assume that is because there will be a feature that allows the butcher to enter the next day.

It would have been better if the creators had waited until they had a beginning scenario (a First Mission"
recommended: perhaps where you are able to get a proper taste of what the gameplay will be like. So the players have an idea of what they can expect from the finished future product.  But
hoursPlayed: I do believe this game is rather promising
voteText: and look forward to a finished product. Or even more of a "first mission" type scenario

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS IS AN *INTERACTIVE* EARLY ACCESS GAME

What do I mean by interactive"? The developers have decided to develop their game with full participation and input from the community. In other words
date: every step from start to finish is guided by community input. Most negative reviews on here are from people who never worked on a game before. I have
recommended:
and this was how we kept our projects on the right track.

That said:

The game is currently in its most rudimentary stages. There's basic movement controls and some nice BGM/effects that promise a fascinating game once finished. Feedback has already led to a few interesting plans for future updates. At this time
voteText: \n\nIf you're looking for a full demo
helpfulPercent: then you will have to wait. However
votesTotal: and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to have an active voice in the game's deveopment"

Product received for free

Early Access Review

Okey so this is Early Access game with own bugs, as every early access games.
DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE UNHAPPY WITH UNFINISHED GAMES. THIS IS ONE OF THEM,BECAUSE IT IS EARLY ACCESS! BUT IT DOES NOT MEAN THAT YOU COULD NOT PLAY IT
Pros:
+Good music for being horror game
+ Graphics are good
+ This atmosphere is good
+ Because there ain't jumpscares on the start you just wait for them

cons:
-Graphics on the roof room are not good (?)
-Unfinished and has some bugs

Should be added:
+Button where you can choose how loud you want to hear the game. I cannot find from the settings and cannot be found from the game. (SERIOUSLY THIS IS NEEDED!)
+More details. Why can we press wooden tables or baskets, if it isn't doing anything?(cellar needs it the most)
+Clicking should be something else than just walking around of the game. You should be able to pick up stuff, anything, which you need. Makes game to be more interested when you can pick up stuff.

The only thing you can click on is to move from there to there.. I know it's in 'Early Access'but if things were be able to be clicked on then that would be great...

Resident Evil 2 was in Early Access when it was coming out, BUT it had different things, like you see Ada earlier on, but in the proper game, you don't see her till later on.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo far this game is broken, or what people lately are calling early access. In my opinion, if your game isn't playable then don't make it available to... well not play. There is nothing more frustrating then loading a game to simply delete it a few minutes later. I hate giving negative reviews, but I've had enough. When the game becomes playable I will be happy to finally play it and give a new review, but until then please remove it from steam. In a world where homeless and poverty stricken individuals have access to computers and internet, some people can only afford free to play games. This game has potential, but that's not enough if it's not functional.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good effort for barely a month old.
Atomsphere is good, shows promise. Translation could be smoother, writer is clearly not a native English speaker.

NOT READY for play though, more of an alpha stage. No actual content yet, just rooms.
